item.title: Nucleophilic-Acyl-Substitutions
item.description: nucleophilic-substitutions Nucleophilic Acyl Substitution is a reaction that carboxylic acid derivatives undergo. It is a 2-step mechanism that involves nucleophilic addition and leaving group removal.

item.title: Nucleophilic-Aromatic-Substitutions
item.description: nucleophilic-substitutions A nucleophile (Nu-) attack an electron poor aromatic molecule, resulting in the substitution of a leaving group Works well with electron withdrawing groups (EWG), such as NO2, since it activates the ring The EWGs work well in the ortho or para positions since the Nu- puts a negative charge on the ring and the EWG can help stabilize it https://www.
